FDG.function_description: Media streaming (TV/shows) browsing & playback

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. First, a click action expands the current live TV (navigating to page 7). Alternatively, a click action navigates back to the Home page (staying on page 0). These are two mutually exclusive branches from the initial page.

steps.summary: Click to expand current live TV
Click to navigate to Home

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to search for media titles, people, and more, while also displaying recent searches and popular media (movies/shows) for quick access or discovery.
data_out: updated search interface state (shows recent/popular searches)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking to open the search page. Then, input a media title (like 'Interstellar') into the search field. After that, there's a choice: either clear the search input (returning to the search page) or filter results by 'Movies' (leading to a filtered movies page, which can be re-filtered by clicking 'Movies' again).

steps.summary: Click to open search page
Input media title in search field
Click to clear search input
Click to filter by Movies
Re-click Movies filter (leaf action)

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Plex app, reached after attempting to cast media, displays a "No Devices Found" message with troubleshooting instructions to help the user connect their mobile device to a compatible streaming device (like a smart TV) for media casting, while also showing media browsing sections for TV shows and live TV content.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Plex home page. First, the user clicks the 'Cast to device' option. This leads to a page showing 'No Devices Found' (and media browsing sections). Then, the user can either close the popup (ending the flow) or interact with the media sections, but here the only action is closing the popup via the X button.

steps.summary: Click 'Cast to device' to attempt casting
Click X to close the popup

FDG.function_description: The Watchlist page (under the "My Watchlist" tab) enables users to add movies and shows (from the displayed recommendations) to their personal watchlist for later viewing, with items removed once watched or marked as watched.
data_out: navigation back to home page state

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0, where the user clicks the Bookmark/Collection icon to navigate to the Watchlist page (page 3). On page 3, the user can either click the 'My Watchlist' tab to view their personal watchlist or the 'Recommended' tab to see recommendations for adding to the watchlist. If needed, the user can click the back arrow to return to page 0.

steps.summary: Click Bookmark/Collection icon to go to Watchlist page (page 3)
Click back navigation arrow to return to page 0
Click 'My Watchlist' tab to view personal watchlist
Click 'Recommended' tab to view recommendations for watchlist

branches.condition: User wants to go back to page 0
User wants to view My Watchlist tab
User wants to view Recommended tab

FDG.function_description: The current page is a side menu in the Plex app, providing options to access Profile, Friends, Services, Downloads, Settings, and Switch Profile, along with a close button to exit the menu and return to media streaming browsing/playback.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the media browsing page (page 0). First, a click action (S1) closes the current view, transitioning to the side menu page (page 4). Then, a click on the close side menu button (S2) exits the menu and returns to the media streaming browsing/playback page (page 4, which remains the same for the close action's destination here).

steps.summary: Click to close current view and open side menu
Click close side menu button to exit menu

FDG.function_description: The current page, under the "On Demand" section's "Categories" tab, allows users to select from various media genres (e.g., Action, Animation, Comedy) to filter and browse relevant TV shows or movies for streaming or playback.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the initial page (page 0) and clicks to expand the genre list, transitioning to page 5 where the full list of media genres is displayed for browsing and filtering content.

steps.summary: Click to expand the genre list from the initial page

FDG.function_description: Displays a curated list of binge - worthy TV shows (after filtering by the Action genre in the media streaming app) with their posters, titles, and number of seasons, enabling users to browse and potentially select shows for playback or further exploration.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the app's home page (page 0). They click the 'Action' genre filter (action_ref [0,5]), which navigates to page 6. On page 6, the app displays a curated list of binge - worthy TV shows filtered by the Action genre, showing each show's poster, title, and number of seasons. The user can then browse this list and potentially select a show for playback or further exploration.

steps.summary: Click the 'Action' genre filter to navigate to the list of Action - genre binge - worthy TV shows

FDG.function_description: The current page (Live TV Guide) functions as a channel guide for live television, allowing users to browse live TV channels, view current and upcoming program schedules, filter by genre (e.g., Comedy), and watch live streaming content, with options to navigate between time slots and categories.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the initial page and clicks to open the channel guide, transitioning to the Live TV Guide page where they can browse channels, view schedules, filter by genre, and watch live content.

steps.summary: Click to open the channel guide

FDG.function_description: The current page (Live TV Guide) enables users to browse, view live TV channel schedules (with program details, timings, and categories like Comedy), watch live TV playback, and navigate through different time slots, channel categories, or favorite channels for media streaming and TV show/channel exploration.
data_out: Weekly Game Preview video playback started

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main page (page 0) and clicks to play the 'Weekly Game Preview' content, transitioning to the playback or related page (page 8). This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click to play Weekly Game Preview

FDG.function_description: The page displays a grid of popular live TV shows with their thumbnails, live indicators, remaining broadcast times, and allows users to browse or select these shows for streaming playback.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0. They click to expand the popular live shows section, transitioning to page 9 where a grid of live TV shows (with thumbnails, live indicators, and remaining times) is displayed. From there, the user can browse or select a show for streaming, though the current flow ends at the expansion step.

steps.summary: Click to expand popular live shows section

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a live TV channel guide, allowing users to browse live TV channels, view currently airing and upcoming programs, filter by category (e.g., Comedy), and navigate through different times and days to see scheduled content, with a live playback window for the currently selected channel.
data_out: live TV playback started (or content loaded)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main page (page 0) and clicks to play the live program 'Breaking Bad', transitioning to the live TV playback page (page 8). This action initiates the live playback of the selected channel's content.

steps.summary: Click to play live Breaking Bad, transitioning to live TV playback page

FDG.function_description: Displays a curated list of binge - worthy TV shows, each with its poster, title, and number of seasons, for users to browse and potentially select for playback after filtering by the Action genre.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0 and clicks to expand the binge - worthy shows section. This action leads to page 6, where a curated list of binge - worthy TV shows (each with poster, title, and season count) is displayed for browsing and potential selection, with the intention to filter by the Action genre next (though the filtering step isn't in the provided actions yet).

steps.summary: Click to expand the binge - worthy shows section

FDG.function_description: The Live TV page provides a guide for browsing, viewing, and navigating live television content, including current and upcoming shows, with options to filter by time, category, and favorite channels, and to play or expand the live video stream.
data_out: Live TV content (channel guide, live programs)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the Live TV page from the home page. Once on the Live TV page, the user can interact with the Today date dropdown to filter or view content by date. There are no further branches or loops in this initial flow as only two actions are provided.

steps.summary: Navigate to Live TV page
Interact with Today date dropdown

FDG.function_description: The On Demand page in the media streaming app allows users to browse, search, and access a curated selection of movies (organized into sections like "Plex Picks," "Holiday Merrython," "Ol' Saint Nic") available for free viewing, rental, or categorized exploration, with options to filter content via "Free To Watch," "Rentals," or "Categories" tabs.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the On Demand page from the home page. Once on On Demand, the user can choose to interact with the Free To Watch tab (or other tabs like Rentals/Categories, though only Free To Watch is shown here) to explore free content. The main flow is a straight line to access On Demand, followed by a potential branch to select a content filter tab.

steps.summary: Navigate to On Demand page
Select Free To Watch tab

FDG.function_description: The Discover page in the media streaming app allows users to browse trending TV shows, movies (including curated lists like those starring specific actors), and sports content (like football), with options to explore different categories (Trending, Activity, People) and access search, device, and bookmark features.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the entry page, then navigates to the Discover page. From there, it proceeds to interact with the Trending tab in the top navigation to view trending content. There are no branches or loops as the current actions form a linear sequence.

steps.summary: Navigate to the Discover page
Click on the Trending tab in top navigation

FDG.function_description: The current page (Search Settings) allows users to configure which media sources (e.g., media libraries, Plex - based options like "More Ways to Watch," "Free to Watch on Plex," etc.) are included when searching for media content in the Plex app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Search page (page 1). They click the search filter toggle button (action_ref [1,1]), which opens the Search Settings page (page 14) to configure media sources for searches. This is a single step to access the settings, with no branches or loops in this initial flow.

steps.summary: Click the search filter toggle button to open Search Settings

FDG.function_description: The current page provides detailed information about the movie "Zootopia 2", including its release year, duration, genre, ratings, a plot summary, and options to manage watchlist status, find where to watch, rate/review, mark as watched, and view more details or cast/crew information.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the search page (page 1). The user clicks the 'Zootopia 2' popular media card, which navigates to the movie's detailed information page (page 15). This is a straight-line flow with no branches or loops, as the only action is accessing the movie's details.

steps.summary: Click the 'Zootopia 2' popular media card to open its detailed info page

FDG.function_description: The page allows the user to choose an app (either Chrome or WebView Browser Tester) to open content related to resolving Plex device casting issues, with options to set a default app or use a different one.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 2 and clicks the 'Need Help?' link. This triggers a browser app selection dialog, where the user can choose to open the help content with Chrome (via 'JUST ONCE' or 'ALWAYS') or use a different app like WebView Browser Tester. The flow branches based on the app and option (default or temporary) selected.

steps.summary: Click 'Need Help?' link to open help content in a browser app

branches.condition: Choose WebView Browser Tester or 'Use a different app'

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to manage their Watchlist by adding movies and shows (from the displayed media options) to it, with items removed once watched or marked as watched.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Watchlist page (page 3). They click on the 'Zootopia' media card (action from [3,3]) to add it to the watchlist. Since this is a single action for adding, the flow is a straight line with no branches or loops here, focusing on selecting a media item to manage (add) in the watchlist.

steps.summary: Click on the Zootopia media card to add it to the watchlist

FDG.function_description: The page displays the user's profile information (username, stats for following/followers/movies/shows/episodes, join date), provides an option to edit the profile, and shows the user's watchlist (with a listed media item), enabling profile management and viewing of personal media-related activity.
data_out: navigation back to plex home page

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 4, where the user clicks the Profile navigation button to navigate to page 34 (the profile page). From the profile page (page 34), the user can click the Back navigation button to return to page 0. There are no branches or loops as the actions are a simple navigation sequence between these pages.

steps.summary: Click Profile navigation button to go to profile page
Click Back navigation button to return to previous page

FDG.function_description: The page displays and manages the user's media downloads, with tabs to view completed downloads, in - progress downloads, and download - related settings, and currently shows that there is no downloaded content.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 4. First, the user clicks the Friends navigation button (action_ref [4,2]) to navigate to page 35. Then, the user clicks the Back navigation arrow (action_ref [35,0]) to return to page 0. There are no branches or loops as the actions are sequential navigation steps.

steps.summary: Click Friends navigation button to go to page 35
Click Back navigation arrow to go to page 0

FDG.function_description: The "My Services" page in the Plex app allows users to select their favorite streaming services, with a "Manage Services" button to customize which services are prioritized in results and recommendations across the app.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 4, where the user clicks the 'Services' navigation button to navigate to page 36. From page 36, the user can click the back navigation arrow to return to page 0. There are no branches or loops in this simple navigation flow.

Click back navigation arrow to return to page 0

FDG.function_description: The page displays the "Completed" tab of the Downloads section, showing that there is no currently downloaded content, with additional tabs for "In Progress" and "Settings" to manage media downloads.

On page 35, the 'Completed' tab is active, showing no downloaded content, with 'In Progress' and 'Settings' tabs available for managing downloads.

FDG.function_description: The page allows the user to select an existing user profile (e.g., "x23314") or add a new user profile within the Plex application.

steps.summary: Click 'Switch Profile' button to navigate to Select User page

FDG.function_description: The page displays a collection of Action - genre on - demand media (movies) with their posters, titles, and release years, enabling users to browse and potentially select these Action - genre movies for playback or further exploration.

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as the playback interface for the movie "Kick - Ass (2010)", enabling users to play, pause, rewind, fast - forward, and control other aspects of the movie's playback.
data_out: video playback state updated (menu interaction result)

core_logic.logic: To start playing the movie 'Kick - Ass (2010)', first click the 'Watch Now' button. Then, on the video player interface, click the 'Play/Pause video button' to control playback. Additionally, there are options to close the video player or access more video options, and interact with the video playback area for further control.

steps.summary: Click 'Watch Now' to start accessing the movie playback
Click 'Play/Pause video button' to control movie playback
Click 'Close video player button' to exit the playback
Click 'More video options button' to access additional playback options
Click on the video playback area for further interaction
Click the video playback clickable region

FDG.function_description: Add to Watchlist button

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 67 (a media details page). They click the 'Add to Watchlist' button, which navigates to page 69. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the Add to Watchlist button

FDG.function_description: Mark as Watched button

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 67 (movie details page). The core action is clicking the 'Mark as Watched' button, which transitions to page 70. There are no branches or loops in this simple flow.

steps.summary: Click the 'Mark as Watched' button

FDG.function_description: The current page provides additional action options for the "Kick - Ass (2010)" movie, specifically allowing users to watch the trailer or share the movie.

core_logic.logic: On the movie details page for 'Kick - Ass (2010)', the user first clicks the 'More' button. This action opens a 'More Actions' menu, presenting two options: 'Watch Trailer' and 'Share This Movie'. The user can then choose either option to perform the corresponding action (watching the trailer or sharing the movie).

steps.summary: Click the 'More' button to open additional action options for the movie

FDG.function_description: The page displays an error message indicating that the Plex app has stopped, with an option to attempt to open the app again.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on a page with content cards. A click on the 'Weekly Game Previews' content card is performed. This action leads to a page where a 'Plex has stopped' error message appears, offering an 'Open app again' option. The core logic involves initiating an action (clicking the card) that triggers the error state with a retry option.

steps.summary: Click on the Weekly Game Previews content card

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to confirm the rental of the movie "Interstellar" for $3.99, providing rental details and options to proceed to checkout or cancel the rental.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the movie details page. First, the user clicks the 'Rent for $3.99' button to open the rental confirmation page. On the confirmation page, the user can either click 'Go to Checkout' to proceed with payment or 'Cancel' to return to the movie details page, creating a branch at the confirmation step.

steps.summary: Click 'Rent for $3.99' to open rental confirmation page
Click 'Go to Checkout' to proceed to checkout
Click 'Cancel' to return to movie details page

FDG.function_description: Add to Watchlist button

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 17 (a media details page). The user clicks the 'Add to Watchlist' button, which navigates to page 20. There are no branches or loops as this is a single action flow.

steps.summary: Click the Add to Watchlist button

FDG.function_description: The current page (More Actions menu for the movie "Kick - Ass") provides additional functionality for the movie, specifically allowing users to watch the trailer and share the movie.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the movie page (page 17). The user clicks the 'More options' button, which opens the 'More Actions' menu (page 21) with options to watch the trailer or share the movie. At this point, the user can choose between these two actions (an if-else branch: either select 'Watch Trailer' or 'Share This Movie').

steps.summary: Click the 'More options' button to open the More Actions menu

FDG.function_description: The page provides options to watch the movie 'Interstellar' (2014) by listing available streaming or rental services (e.g., Plex On Demand, Hoopla, YouTube, Paramount Plus) with their respective access details (rental cost, free, subscription) and a link for more services.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 18, where the 'Watch Now' button is clicked to navigate to page 26 (the 'Watch Now' modal). On page 26, a branch occurs: either the 'Rent $3.99 (Plex On Demand)' button is clicked (leading to page 19) or the back arrow is clicked (returning to page 18).

steps.summary: Click 'Watch Now' button to open the modal with streaming/rental options.
Click 'Rent $3.99 (Plex On Demand)' button to proceed with renting.
Click back arrow to close the 'Watch Now' modal and return to the previous page.

FDG.function_description: Plays the trailer for the movie Kick - Ass (2010) after being accessed from the movie's detail page via the "Watch Trailer" option in the "More Actions" popup.

core_logic.logic: From the movie detail page (page 21), click the 'Watch Trailer' button in the 'More Actions' popup to navigate to the trailer page (page 23). Then, click the 'Play/Pause Trailer Button' on the trailer page (page 23) to start playing the Kick - Ass (2010) trailer.

steps.summary: Click 'Watch Trailer' button in 'More Actions' popup
Click Play/Pause Trailer Button to play trailer

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to choose from a list of available widgets (e.g., clocks, app shortcuts, Chrome-related widgets, etc.) to add or configure, likely for a home screen or similar interface customization.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 21 and clicks the 'Share This Movie' button, which navigates to page 24. This is a single-step flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click 'Share This Movie' button

FDG.function_description: This page provides options to change the user's profile image, allowing the user to either take a new photo or choose an existing image from their device's library.
data_out: profile image change options (take photo, choose from library)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Edit Profile page. First, they click the 'Change Profile Image' button to open the image selection options. Then, they choose between taking a new photo (implied by the flow) or selecting an existing image from the library; in this case, the example shows clicking 'Choose From Library' to access device photos.

steps.summary: Click 'Change Profile Image' button to open image options
Click 'Choose From Library' button to access device photos

FDG.function_description: Full Name input field

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Edit Profile page (page 39). The user inputs 'Jane Doe' into the Full Name input field, which transitions the app to page 42. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Input 'Jane Doe' into the Full Name input field

FDG.function_description: The page functions as the Plex app's settings hub, providing options to configure account, home, experience, notifications, player experience, subtitles, advanced, privacy, and about settings, along with a search bar for quick navigation.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the settings hub page. The user clicks the 'Account settings' button, navigating to the account settings page. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the Account settings button to navigate to account settings page

FDG.function_description: The page displays recommended media content (including new trailers from the user's watchlist and recently added items) in the "Recommended" tab of the watchlist management section, allowing users to view and explore suggested shows/movies.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Watchlist page (page 40). They click the 'Recommended' tab (action_ref [40,0]), which navigates to the Recommended page (page 50) displaying media recommendations like new trailers from the watchlist and recently added items. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Recommended' tab in the Watchlist page to navigate to the Recommended page showing media recommendations.

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a "Filter by" menu for the watchlist, allowing users to filter watchlist content by categories such as "All," "Available on Plex," "Available on Your Services," "Available to Stream," and "Released."

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Watchlist page (page 40). They click the 'All' content filter button, which opens the 'Filter by' menu (page 51) with options like 'All', 'Available on Plex', etc. This action initiates the filtering flow for the watchlist content.

steps.summary: Click the 'All' content filter button to open the 'Filter by' menu

FDG.function_description: The page provides a "Sort by" menu for the watchlist, allowing the user to select from sorting options like "Added At", "Title", "Release Date", "Audience Rating", "Critic Rating", and "Available At" to organize the watchlist items.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Watchlist page (page 40). First, the user clicks the 'Added At' sort button (action [40,2]), navigating to a page (page 52) with sorting options. Then, the user clicks the 'Sort by Title' option (action [52,0]), returning to the Watchlist page (page 40) with the list sorted by title. There are no branches as the actions form a linear sequence of selecting a sort button and then a specific sort option.

steps.summary: Click 'Added At' sort button to open sorting options page
Click 'Sort by Title' option to sort watchlist by title and return to Watchlist page

FDG.function_description: The page provides detailed information about the movie "Zootopia 2" (including release year, duration, genre, ratings, plot summary, and cast/crew) and offers actions like removing from the watchlist, finding where to watch, rating/reviewing, marking as watched, and accessing more options.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Watchlist page (page 40). The user clicks on the 'Zootopia 2' watchlist item, which navigates to the movie's detailed information page (page 15) where actions like removing from watchlist, finding where to watch, rating/reviewing, marking as watched, and accessing more options are available.

steps.summary: Click on Zootopia 2 watchlist item to navigate to its detailed info page

FDG.function_description: The current page (under the "Requests" tab in the "Friends" section of Plex) is intended to display and manage friend requests (sent or received), with information on how to handle rejections, blocks, and rescinding sent requests.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Friends page (Requests tab). The user clicks the 'All Friends' tab button, which keeps the page on the same screen (dst_page_idx matches src_page_idx). This action switches the view from 'Requests' to 'All Friends' within the Friends section.

steps.summary: Click the 'All Friends' tab button to switch from Requests to All Friends view.

FDG.function_description: A&E service selection checkbox

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'Manage Services' page (page 60). The core action is clicking the checkbox next to the A&E service, which transitions the app to page 61. There are no branches or loops here, as its a single click action to select the A&E service.

steps.summary: Click the checkbox for A&E service

FDG.function_description: The current page allows the user to configure content restrictions (e.g., None, Little Kid, Older Kid, Teen) for a newly created managed Plex account, with descriptions of allowed content ratings and notes on advanced restrictions.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 62 (Create Managed Account). First, they click the Restrictions settings button (action_ref [62,1]) to navigate to page 64. From page 64, they can click the back arrow (action_ref [64,0]) to return to page 62, allowing navigation between the account creation and restrictions configuration pages.

steps.summary: Click Restrictions settings button to go to restrictions config page
Click back arrow to return to account creation page

FDG.function_description: The page allows the user to choose an app (e.g., Chrome, WebView Browser Tester) to open the free Hoopla streaming option for the movie 'Interstellar' (2014) after selecting the "Watch Now" action from its movie action menu.

core_logic.logic: From the 'Watch Now' menu for 'Interstellar' (2014), the user clicks the 'Hoopla (Free)' streaming option. This triggers an app selection dialog to appear, where the user can choose an app (e.g., Chrome, WebView Browser Tester) to open the Hoopla stream.

steps.summary: Click the 'Hoopla (Free)' streaming option in the 'Watch Now' menu

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a camera interface to take a photo for updating the user's profile image, with a viewfinder displaying the current scene and a camera shutter button to capture the image.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the profile edit page. The user clicks the 'Take Photo' button, which navigates to the camera interface page, where the viewfinder displays the current scene and a shutter button is available to capture the image.

steps.summary: Click 'Take Photo' button to open camera interface

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a search interface within the settings section, allowing users to search for specific settings (e.g., "notifications") and view relevant results.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the settings page. First, they input 'notifications' into the search field to find relevant settings. Then, they can click the clear search text button to remove the input and reset the search interface.

steps.summary: Input 'notifications' into settings search field
Click clear search text button

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to manage notification settings for various categories (Plex News, Friends & Followers, Discover, On Demand & Live TV) by toggling options like Feature Updates, My Messages, Watchlisted Item Now Available, etc.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Settings page (page 43). They click the 'Notifications' settings button, which navigates to the Notifications page (page 47) where various notification categories and toggles are displayed. From there, the user can manage (toggle) individual notification options for categories like Plex News, Friends & Followers, etc.

steps.summary: Click the Notifications settings button to navigate to the Notifications page.

FDG.function_description: The page displays new trailers for media items from the user's watchlist, allowing users to view and potentially interact with (e.g., play trailers, get details) the listed content (e.g., "Zootopia 2" with its release date).

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Watchlist page (page 50). They click the 'New Trailers from Your Watchlist' arrow, which navigates to the New Trailers from Your Watchlist page (page 53) to view trailers for watchlist media like 'Zootopia 2'.

steps.summary: Click 'New Trailers from Your Watchlist' arrow to navigate to trailers page

FDG.function_description: Plays the trailer for "Zootopia 2" as accessed from the recommended watchlist section of the user's watchlist management page.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 72. They click the 'Add to Watchlist' button, which navigates to page 74. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

FDG.function_description: The Notifications settings page allows users to manage notification preferences for Plex News, Friends & Followers, Discover, and On Demand & Live TV categories by toggling or selecting specific notification types.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Settings page (page 46). The user clicks the 'Notifications' settings option, navigating to the Notifications settings page (page 47) where notification preferences for various categories can be managed.

steps.summary: Click 'Notifications' settings option to navigate to Notifications settings page

FDG.function_description: Feature Updates notification toggle

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Notifications page (page 47). They perform a click action on the Feature Updates notification toggle, which leads to a new page (page 49). This action toggles the state of the Feature Updates notification setting.

FDG.function_description: Plays the trailer for "Zootopia 2" as accessed from the "New Trailers from Your Watchlist" section in the watchlist management area of the Plex app.

core_logic.logic: The user navigates to the 'New Trailers from Your Watchlist' page (page 53). Then, the user clicks on the 'Zootopia 2' trailer card, which triggers the trailer to start playing (transition to page 54, which is the video playback page).

FDG.function_description: Plays the trailer video for "Zootopia 2" after navigating through the Plex app's user profile, watchlist, and recommended trailers sections.

FDG.function_description: This page functions to play and display a specific scene from the "Zootopia 2" trailer, allowing user interaction with the trailer playback.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 55 and clicks the trailer interaction button to move to page 56. From page 56, the user clicks the trailer play/advance button to move to page 57. On page 57, the user can repeatedly click the trailer play/advance button (loop) to continue interacting with the trailer playback.

steps.summary: Click trailer interaction button
Click trailer play/advance button
Click trailer play/advance button (loop)
